title: Panic 'attempt to steal from stolen value' when attempting to update rust from 1.51 to 1.52 on Gentoo

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
I'm trying to update `dev-lang/rust` from 1.51 to 1.52 and it fails with an internal compiler error. ### Meta Using the `rustc` built by the bootstrapping process. ``` note: rustc 1.52.1-nightly (gentoo) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -Z fewer-names=yes -Z force-overflow-checks=yes -Z threads=16 -Z unstable-options=yes -Z macro-backtrace -Z tls-model=initial-exec -Z unstable-options -Z binary-dep-depinfo -Z force-unstable-if-unmarked -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=0 -C linker=x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-gcc -C prefer-dynamic --crate-type lib ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'attempt to steal from stolen value', compiler/rustc_mir/src/transform/mod.rs:587:89 ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt 2: core::option::expect_failed 3: rustc_mir::transform::optimized_mir 4: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl 5: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 6: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::force_query_with_job 7: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 8: ::optimized_mir 9: rustc_metadata::rmeta::encoder::EncodeContext::encode_crate_root 10: rustc_metadata::rmeta::encoder::encode_metadata_impl 11: rustc_rayon_core::join::join_context::{{closure}} 12: rustc_metadata::rmeta::encoder::encode_metadata 13: rustc_metadata::rmeta::decoder::cstore_impl::::encode_metadata 14: rustc_middle::ty::context::TyCtxt::encode_metadata 15: rustc_interface::passes::start_codegen 16: rustc_rayon_core::tlv::with 17: rustc_interface::queries::Queries::ongoing_codegen 18: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 19: rustc_span::with_source_map 20: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run 21: std::panicking::try 22: as rustc_rayon_core::job::Job>::execute 23: rustc_rayon_core::registry::WorkerThread::wait_until_cold 24: rustc_rayon_core::registry::ThreadBuilder::run 25: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set 26: crossbeam_utils::thread::ScopedThreadBuilder::spawn::{{closure}} ```

You can find the full Portage build log (warning: ~4 MiB in size) and `emerge --info` output [here](https://gist.github.com/xxc3nsoredxx/05e11fee1b2b804328554e3573c8dd7d).
